identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Anti-IL5 Biological Treatments on Blood IgE Levels in Severe Asthmatic Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Anti-IL5 Biological Treatments of Total Blood IgE Levels in Severe Asthmatic Patients: Real-life Retrospective Multicenter Observational Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Real-life, observational, retrospective, multicenter study to evaluate the effects of anti-IL5 biological treatments on blood total IgE Levels in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Severe asthma, i.e. asthma that is not controlled despite maximal optimized therapy and/or that worsens when high dose treatment is decreased (GINA guidelines - available at https://ginasthma.or), is a major unmet medical need. Major advances in the management of severe asthma occurred in the past few years due to the new targeted biological therapies. Mepolizumab and Benralizumab are humanized monoclonal antibodies able to block interleukin (IL)-5 and the receptor for IL-5, respectively. These biological treatments block the eosinophilic driven inflammation. The effects of these treatments on an other key effector molecule of the T2-immune response, i.e. IgE, is virtually unknown.

To explore this issue, we set up a real life, observational, retrospective, multicenter study. The study will enroll patients with severe eosinophilic asthma already treated with Mepolizumab or Benralizumab. The following variable will be collected before the the biological treatment and at 4±2 months after the initiation of the pharmacological regimen:

* demographic data
* age of onset of asthma
* smoking habit
* concomitant pharmacological regimens
* number of asthma exacerbations since last visit
* concomitant diseases (particularly gastroesophageal reflux, nasal polyposis, atopic dermatitis, obesity, anxiety-depressive syndrome).
* White Blood Cell Count and Differential (and in particular the levels of total leucocytes, lymphocytes, eosinophils and basophils)
* Lung function tests (spirometry)

armGroups.label: Mepolizumab group
armGroups.description: atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma treated with anti-IL-5 monoclonal antibody (Mepolizumab)

armGroups.label: Benralizumab group
armGroups.description: atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma treated with anti-IL5 receptor monoclonal antibody (Benralizumab)

interventions.name: Total IgE
interventions.description: Levels of total IgE before biological treatments and at 4±2 months of treatments

interventions.name: Blood cell counts
interventions.description: White Blood Cell Count and Differential (and in particular the levels of total leucocytes, lymphocytes, eosinophils and basophils)

interventions.name: Asthma control assessment
interventions.description: Levels of asthma control assessed by asthma control questionnaire (ACT) before initiation of biological treatments and at 4± months of treatments

interventions.name: lung function tests
interventions.description: Lung function tests performed before initiation of biological treatments and at 4± months of treatments

primaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate total IgE levels (kU/l) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months after initiation of anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Total leucocytes in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate total leucocytes (number of cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Eosinophils (number) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood eosinophils (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Eosinophils (%) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the percentage of blood eosinophils (%) total blood white cells in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Basophils (number) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood basophils (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Basophils (%) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the percentage of blood basophils (%) to totale white blood cells in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: lymphocytes (number) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood lymphocytes (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Lymphocytes (%) in mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the percentage of blood lymphocytes (%) to total white cells in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with anti-IL5 monoclonal antibody Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: IgE levels in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate total IgE levels (kU/l) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Total leucocytes in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate total leucocytes (number of cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab compared to the pretreatment value

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Eosinophils (number) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood eosinophils (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Eosinophils (%) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the percentage of blood eosinophils (%) total blood white cells in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Basophils (number) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood basophils (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Basophils (%) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the percentage of blood basophils (%) to totale white blood cells in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Lymphocytes (number) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the number of blood lymphocytes (cell/µl) in atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Lymphocites (%) in Benralizumab group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1 - liter) in Mepolizumab group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1/FVC ratio) in Mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FEV1/FVC ratio in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Mepolizumab compared to the pretreatment value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1/VC ratio) in Mepolizumab group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1 - %) in Benralizumab group

secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FEV1 (liter) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FVC - %) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FVC (% predicted) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (VC - liter) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate VC (liter) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (VC - %) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate VC (% predicted) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1/FVC ratio) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FEV1/VC ratio in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab compared to the pretreatment value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: respiratory function (FEV1/VC ratio) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FEV1/FVC ratio in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fractional exhaled nitric oxigen (FeNO) in Mepozumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FeNO (ppb) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Fractional exhaled nitric oxigen (FeNO) in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate FeNO (ppb) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of treatment with Benraluzumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Asthma control test in Mepolizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate asthma control test (ACT) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of Mepolizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Asthma control test in Benralizumab group
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate asthma control test (ACT) in patients with severe eosinophilic asthma at baseline and at baseline and at 4 ± 2 months from the start of Benralizumab

secondaryOutcomes.measure: correlation between eosinophils and total IgE
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the correlations (Pearson correlation coefficient) between the change in total eosinophil counts and IgE levels in patients treated with Mepolizumab or Benralizumab.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: correlation between total IgE and lung function
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the correlations (Pearson correlation coefficient) between the change in total IgE levels and in functional parameters (FEV1, FVC and VC) in patients treated with Mepolizumab or Benralizumab.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: correlation between total IgE and asthma control
secondaryOutcomes.description: To evaluate the correlations (Pearson correlation coefficient) between the change in total IgE levels and the change of asthma control (measured by asthma control test - ACT) in patients treated with Mepolizumab or Benralizumab.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* atopy
* severe eosinophilic asthma (according to GINA guideline - available at https://ginasthma.org)
* patients treated with monoclonal antibody anti IL-5 (Mepolizumab) or with IL-5 anti-receptor monoclonal antibody (Benralizumab).
* stable asthma (free from asthma exacerbation for at least 8 weeks)

Exclusion Criteria:

* asthma exacerbation in last 8 weeks
* patients treated for COPD
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: atopic patients with severe eosinophilic asthma treated with anti IL-5 (Mepolizumab) or anti IL5-receptor (Benralizumab) humanized monoclonal antibodies
